page.title: 16CHANGES IN PONTELAND.
page.content: Mr.William Abbey,79,is a{shoemaker and repairer,in the village of Ponteland. He came to{Ponteland} at the age of 14 from Malton,Yorkshire.He served his time in the tanneries,repairing shoes. He returned to Ponteland and found himself a job.He later became caretaker at our school,Coates Endowed Middle where he{retired}aged 65. We asked him what he thought about how the village has changed:"The village of Ponteland was a very nice little village,with very few houses and shops,but enough to satisfy the local population.Today 50 years on it's all built up,like a town,farms have been taken over and banks built. The old vicarage is now a Rest Home. All of the shops have been changed and modernised.Ponteland has changed considerably not always for the best."
